channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trip Hazard Water Stoptaps, 29th January
item.description:
Over time the paving/infill around this pair of STW stop tap covers has sunk, or otherwise eroded to the point where they now present a tripping hazard. Location: on the pavement/footpath outside nos. 99 and 101 Ashlands Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 97 Ashlands Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes, 29th January
item.description:
Multiple potholes St Paul’s Road Cheltenham junction with Dunalley St and Marle Hill Parade including a very deep one

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 5b Dunalley Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole St Paul’s Road Cheltenham, 29th January
item.description:
Pothole in road outside 23 St Paul’s Road, Cheltenham Approx 1 ft across, over an inch deep

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 23 Saint Paul's Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Litter and dog fouling, 29th January
item.description:
This lane is full of rubbish. The latest thing is dumping poo bags in trees. Please can it be cleaned and a patrol put in place? This is really putting me off coming here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 38 Everest Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter dumped, 29th January
item.description:
Litter dumped on verge

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Everest Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hole in Pavement, 29th January
item.description:
Hole in Pavement on Melville Road outside number 9. It is adjacent to a Severn Trent water stop tap cover. Hole is at least 4inches deep

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Melville Road, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dirty Pedestrian Traffic island markers, 29th January
item.description:
Reflective markers on main road traffic crossings for pedestrians are so dirty that they can’t be seen. Witnessed cars almost hit them. Dangerous for cars but especially pedestrians in poor weather/dark conditions. Need cleaning urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Patch Gotherington Fields, Gotherington
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): West Drive, Cheltenham

item.title: Christmas tree dumped, 28th January
item.description:
Someone has dumped a real Christmas tree outside my house on welch road it's been there 2 days now
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 44 Welch Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Foodwaste bin full of empties outside 89 St Paul’s Road, 28th January
item.description:
This has been here for well over 2 weeks. Please just come and take it away. If you have time to educate the householder on how recycling / foodwaste works and encourage them to use the appropriate containers, that would be a bonus.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 25 Victoria Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping lane between Albert St and Victoria St, 28th January
item.description:
Another household treating the street as their dustbin. Loads of black bags of rubbish and other random bin bags, green recycling box full of non recyclables, and just loose rubbish like boxes and packaging. There is no excuse for this. They get weekly bin collections for goodness sake. So tempted to just toss the whole lot back into their garden. Maybe environmental health could pay them a visit/ throw it back in their garden for them to sort out

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 25 Victoria Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping rear Albert St, 28th January
item.description:
Flytipping in lane between Albert St & Victoria St. I’m sure it’s been reported before but more and more things are being added. Black leather chair, fake Christmas tree, cabinet, plastic garden chairs and more

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Prospect Cottage Albert Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 5 Albert Street, Cheltenham

item.title: Asb, 28th January
item.description:
The entrance to the allotments on Henley Road has become a regular parking spot for ASB. Residents have reported that cars park between the hours of midnight and 3am. The consumption of a large amount of gas from all these cannisters is shocking. Sadly, this is becoming a regular spot for this behaviour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 84 Henley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
